plot: Basil plans a surprise anniversary party for Sybil but, thinking he's forgotten it again, she walks out just before the guests arrive.

Outraged that Basil has forgotten their 15th wedding anniversary, Sybil leaves the hotel. But little does she know that Basil has indeed remembered and has invited some of their close friends to celebrate. How will Basil explain Sybil's absence?—Nadia Nassar

Having forgotten their 14th wedding anniversary the year before, Basil decides to throw a small party with friends to celebrate their 15th. He pretends to have forgotten and a hurt Sybil decides to walk out, seriously questioning the future of their marriage. Rather than tell the guests what has really happened, he concocts a tale that she is ill. When they insist on seeing her, he pays Polly to impersonate her. It all seems to work - until Sybil walks into the hotel.—garykmcd
